text: The White Oak Creek Covered Bridge, near Alvaton, Georgia, was built in 1880. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973. It was a c.1880 work, probably of Horace King, a former slave born in 1807. It is a Long truss covered bridge. With Remains of the bridge in April 2013 It is located southeast of Alvaton on Covered Bridge Rd. It burned down in 1985. Only metal pilings and a skeleton of the deck remain. ==References== Category:Covered bridges in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:National Register of Historic Places in Meriwether County, Georgia Category:Bridges completed in 1880
title: White Oak Creek Covered Bridge
